newsitem.title: USA: Republican Party returns $100,000 to Hong Kong.
newsitem.headline: Republican Party returns $100,000 to Hong Kong.

text.p: The U.S. Republican National Committee said on Thursday it had returned over $100,000 in political contributions because it learned the money came from the Hong Kong parent company of a Florida-based subsidiary.

It was the first time the Republicans have been forced to return a foreign contribution. The Democratic Party has acknowledged receiving over $3 million in questionable foreign funds. The Justice Department and two congressional committees are investigating the affair.
A statement by RNC chairman Jim Nicholson said the money was returned Wednesday as soon as it became clear the money had originated in Hong Kong.
The contributions came from Young Brothers Development USA. Nicholson said the party had no reason to believe the money came from overseas when it accepted the donation.

"We were not able to secure the facts from the company until (Wednesday) afternoon when a company officer reported by telephone that the source of the funds was not an American company...but a 'parent' company in Hong Kong," Nicholson said.
"Upon learning those facts, we immediately returned the contributions before day's end," he said.
